description: Continuation of CHEM 221. Principles and applications of thermodynamics, and a molecular-based understanding of macroscopic properties.
name: PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY II

values.comments:
This course is a continuation of CHEM 221. It covers principles and applications of thermodynamics, and a molecular-based understanding of macroscopic properties. 

Students found the course to be a “good course for basic thermodynamics.” Material was presented “much better than Chem 221.” The PowerPoints were “extremely helpful in putting together the material” from lecture and the textbook. Some students felt that “independent study was the key to this course.” 

Professor Gai “is able to stimulate interest throughout the class by humorous, yet appropriate analogies,” although some felt that his analogies were “not very helpful, but very entertaining.” One student remarked that Professor Gai “is pretty good at teaching the course material.” While many students were pleased with lecture, one student found it to be “unbearably boring.”

CHEM 221 and PHYS 151 are pre-requisites for this class. For each midterm, Professor Gai provided a practice midterm from the previous year. 
Note: Less than eight students reviewed this course.
